content:
<ce:para id="para0010" view="all">Compound <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>
 was prepared from hydrothermal reaction. A mixture of (NH<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>Mo<ce:inf loc="post">7</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">24</ce:inf>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>·<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>4H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (1.12<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g), CuSO<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>·<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>5H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.11<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g), KF<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>·<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.15<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g), phen (0.14<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g), and 10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>ml H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O was stirred for 40<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>min in air. The resulting gel with a pH of 4.5–5.0 was then transferred to a 20<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL Teflon-lined autoclave and kept at 160<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C for 6 days. After the mixture was slowly cooled to room temperature, green block crystals were isolated in 37% yield (based on Mo).</ce:para>
clean_text: Compound 1  was prepared from hydrothermal reaction. A mixture of (NH4)6Mo7O24 ⋅4H2O (1.12g), CuSO4 ⋅5H2O (0.11g), KF⋅2H2O (0.15g), phen (0.14g), and 10ml H2O was stirred for 40min in air. The resulting gel with a pH of 4.5-5.0 was then transferred to a 20mL Teflon-lined autoclave and kept at 160°C for 6 days. After the mixture was slowly cooled to room temperature, green block crystals were isolated in 37% yield (based on Mo).
